title: How to Make an Olive Oil and Salt Conditioning Treatment for Nails

steps.headline: Place a round and deep bowl onto your work space.
steps.description: Check that you are able to dip your hands in the bowl, with ease.

steps.headline: Add about 1 to 2 cups of water.
steps.description: The amount depends on how long your fingers are.

steps.headline: Add 2 tablespoons of salt.
steps.description: You can add more than 2 tablespoons if needed.

steps.headline: Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
steps.description: If you don't have olive oil, then you can use vegetable oil in its place.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients together.
steps.description: Keep stirring until the salt is dissolved completely.

steps.headline: Dip your hands in it for about 10 to 20 minutes.
steps.description: If you can soak for longer, that's even better.

steps.headline: Wash your hands after soaking.
steps.description: Finish up by applying your favorite moisturizer.

steps.headline: Repeat this method for a few days in a row or every few days over a few weeks.
steps.description: The need depends on your observed nail growth. It should help to condition and strengthen your nails as part of a healthy self-care regime of a nutritious diet, exercise and appropriate hygiene.
